thread.title: DW Reporting announces continue team growth with the recruitment of Jon Roscow.
thread.title_full: DW Reporting announces continue team growth with the recruitment of Jon Roscow.

title: DW Reporting announces continue team growth with the recruitment of Jon Roscow.
text:
Posted: 30   
DW Reporting, the leaders in software agnostic legal BI and data solutions, has today announced that Jon Roscow, formally of Laureus Consulting, IntApp and Billback, has joined the team as Commercial Director. 
With 18 new wins already, 2015 has been an unprecedented year for DW Reporting and we have quickly become the de facto provider of legal BI and reporting services in the EMEA region” states Dan Wales, Managing Director, DW Reporting. “We are delighted that Jon has decided to join DW Reporting full time as his knowledge and breadth of skills in the legal IT sector will assist the team with both our growth and investment strategies.” 
“DW Reporting is an exciting and refreshing organisation to be a part of,” said Jon Roscow, Commercial Director, DW Reporting. “I have worked with Dan and the team already for some time and their approach to this market, the services they provide, general company approach and overall attitude are the reasons for their success and meteoric growth in the last three years.” 
“Starting with a core consulting service in 2013, our portfolio has expanded since that point to include managed reporting services (ASSIGN), dedicated legal multijurisdictional BI environments (QUANTUM) and matter planning, budgeting and pricing services (EVALUATE). “This is the tip of the iceberg and we are working with our global clients on new product enhancements, whilst continuing to provide well respected and successful services consultancy.” continues Dan Wales “Jon’s expertise in developing legal products and services and commercial acumen within our domain - the law firm environment is key to our success.” 
“There are exciting times ahead, the legal market is more buoyant than it has been for a number of years and law firms are ready and want to make significant change to the way they deliver their products and services.” adds Jon, “Underpinning this is the need for access to effective, timely and accurate business information. Business intelligence is no longer seen as too difficult or nice to have. Enterprise management information is the difference between success and failure.” 
Share:
